context: The word 'kuukausi' in Finnish means 'month'. It is a unit of time, and can refer to any month of the year. The word is derived from 'kuu' (moon) + 'kausi' (period).  It declines based on case; the provided dictionary definitions show many forms for different grammatical contexts. For example, 'kuukauden' means 'of the month', while 'kuukausia' means 'months'. It can also be used in possessive forms like 'kuukauteni' meaning 'my month'.
